comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://www.sakuyaoi.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sakuyaoi.com) ### Comment > ## The Problem > When using AdGuard DNS Family Safety, images on certain Japanese websites, even those that are not NSFW, do not display correctly. This is an issue with AdGuard DNS Family Safety specifically, as it does not occur with the standard AdGuard DNS, and the same problem happens even on PCs. > > ## Steps to Reproduce > 1. Set the DNS settings within the AdGuard app to AdGuard DNS Family Safety (During this setup, I use the QUIC protocol.) > 2. Access the specified website. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/43mvlxxli7uoco0wc4kwoo8cg848kw4lssz69256xw.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/kaqmgtg8g5c4gckg48sowo888ck44kknj26h39u6mo.png?nc=1)

Block trackers,
Send Do-Not-Track header

Self-destructing third-party cookies (180),
Self-destructing first-party cookies (4320)

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: AdGuard for Android blocks sending any media in Discord chats
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.12.77

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

discord.com

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

With AdGuard HTTPS filtering enabled on Android (Google Pixel 9 Pro), I am unable to send any media in any discord chat. It uploads and then disappears.

Turning AdGuard HTTPS filtering off resolves the issue. Reproduced this several times in a row, seems like a consistent bug.

### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/13b56795-26bd-4696-b89b-5619035d515a)

comment.body: You need to enable the AdGuard Tracking Protection filter to block it. Also, on a side note, if you look at the bottom left of the popup, there is an option called 'I'll fix it next time' that will let you skip it.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.deezer.com/us/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.deezer.com%2Fus%2F) ### Comment > Deezer application and online website is being blocked by something in the backend. Think it is something like blazer. The notification, "You're computer seems to be offline. We'll keep trying to connect" keeps popping up, even though music still streams. This issue does not happen when I switch to another DNS server, but haven't tested extensively. It has been a complaint on Deezer forums for a long time, but they refuse to fix it. ### Screenshots
